com.dynatrace.openkit

Class OpenKitFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dynatrace.openkit.OpenKitFactory

  • public class OpenKitFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    This factory creates instances of the OpenKit to work with. It can be used to create instances for both Dynatrace AppMon and Dynatrace SaaS/Managed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static OpenKit createAppMonInstance(java.lang.String applicationName, java.lang.String applicationID, long visitorID, java.lang.String endpointURL)
      Creates a Dynatrace AppMon instance of the OpenKit.
      static OpenKit createAppMonInstance(java.lang.String applicationName, java.lang.String applicationID, long visitorID, java.lang.String endpointURL, boolean verbose)
      Creates a Dynatrace AppMon instance of the OpenKit, optionally with verbose logging.
      static OpenKit createDynatraceInstance(java.lang.String applicationName, java.lang.String applicationID, long visitorID, java.lang.String endpointURL)
      Creates a Dynatrace SaaS/Managed instance of the OpenKit.
      static OpenKit createDynatraceInstance(java.lang.String applicationName, java.lang.String applicationID, long visitorID, java.lang.String endpointURL, boolean verbose)
      Creates a Dynatrace SaaS/Managed instance of the OpenKit, optionally with verbose logging.

    • Method Detail

      • createDynatraceInstance

        public static OpenKit createDynatraceInstance(java.lang.String applicationName,
                                              java.lang.String applicationID,
                                              long visitorID,
                                              java.lang.String endpointURL)
        Creates a Dynatrace SaaS/Managed instance of the OpenKit.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - the application name
        applicationID - the application ID (must be a valid application UUID)
        visitorID - unique visitor ID
        endpointURL - the URL of the beacon forwarder to send the data to
        Returns:
        Dynatrace SaaS/Managed instance of the OpenKit

      • createDynatraceInstance

        public static OpenKit createDynatraceInstance(java.lang.String applicationName,
                                              java.lang.String applicationID,
                                              long visitorID,
                                              java.lang.String endpointURL,
                                              boolean verbose)
        Creates a Dynatrace SaaS/Managed instance of the OpenKit, optionally with verbose logging.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - the application name
        applicationID - the application ID (must be a valid application UUID)
        visitorID - unique visitor ID
        endpointURL - the URL of the beacon forwarder to send the data to
        verbose - if true, turn on verbose logging on stdout
        Returns:
        Dynatrace SaaS/Managed instance of the OpenKit

      • createAppMonInstance

        public static OpenKit createAppMonInstance(java.lang.String applicationName,
                                           java.lang.String applicationID,
                                           long visitorID,
                                           java.lang.String endpointURL)
        Creates a Dynatrace AppMon instance of the OpenKit.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - the application name
        applicationID - the application ID
        visitorID - unique visitor ID
        endpointURL - the URL of the Java/Webserver Agent to send the data to
        Returns:
        Dynatrace AppMon instance of the OpenKit

      • createAppMonInstance

        public static OpenKit createAppMonInstance(java.lang.String applicationName,
                                           java.lang.String applicationID,
                                           long visitorID,
                                           java.lang.String endpointURL,
                                           boolean verbose)
        Creates a Dynatrace AppMon instance of the OpenKit, optionally with verbose logging.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - the application name
        applicationID - the application ID
        visitorID - unique visitor ID
        endpointURL - the URL of the Java/Webserver Agent to send the data to
        verbose - if true, turn on verbose logging on stdout
        Returns:
        Dynatrace AppMon instance of the OpenKit
